caption: I  found it quite disappointing--the on line menu has nothing to do with what they have on hand. I had a very ordinary burger, which they charged top dollar for!!
Great wine bar and restaurant on Capitol hill. We came for a private party upstairs- staff were very friendly, food was great, and the drinks too . Highly recommend
Hands down. You will enjoy it. I'm definitely going back there.
Sat outside and had an enjoyable evening here. Our meals were great and the wine list was varied and had many affordable options.

At the first moment  you step in that place  the stuff gives you a good feeling. Very warm waiters, it is a nice place to to go out with buddies or with your date. yummy  food, skillful  chef de cuisine, reasonable  pay and courteous  service. Warmly recommended.

Loved the experience here. Outdoor dining coupled with the wine selections and good food. Service from Shari the manager was top notch. She was very professional and curtios. Definitely will be going back.
Wine selection is limited but there are some nice options.  Service is lukewarm.  Menu is also limited and food is overpriced -- not gourmet.  In short, this place is not ready for prime time.
Beer was warm, service at the bar is slow, just had drinks,

We had the chef’s tasting with wine pairings which was delicious, unique and varied. They pulled it together with very little notice. It was a donation to our kid’s school so generous too! And to top it off they catered to one person being Vegan (such a pain for a chef). They were gracious about it and the food (all of it - vegan and not) was fantastic! Unique tastes. Many courses. It is an unassuming place with a cool vibe. Worth the short trip to SE!
Nice atmosphere and happy hour upstairs. Fireplace is great in the winter
Service was great. Drinks were great. Food was good but not great. The NY strip was a little fatty for my taste, and I didn't care for the green sauce atop it.
The food is regularly well prepared and yummy, workers provides good customer service. I really like how neat it is and mood. Highly recommended.

I’ve been before and I feel like the quality of food and ingredients were incredible. But they truly topped themselves for restaurant week. I got oyster stew, whole dorado, and creme caramel w chocolate pearls. Amazing.
Pretty good!!!!
I went on Saturday for drinks and the bartender was super nice and friendly. Great service.
O yeahreat times
The food was great, and the staff members were very helpful.
Absolutely a spot worth trying, the food is excellent and fresh, the cost is affordable and it is consistently neat here. 5 stars.
Great wine bar and restaurant on Capitol hill. We came for a private party upstairs- staff were very friendly, food was great, and the drinks too (they have more than just wine). Highly recommend!

My partner and I planned on eating at Sonoma before catching a performance at the Folger Shakespeare Library. We walked in and asked for a table for two. The hostess informed us that it was reservations only, which was totally fine. However she then proceeded to tell us that "young people sure don't know how to make reservations" and that the restaurant was busy with older couples that come before the show. It was unnecessary and made us feel unwelcome and we took our business to a very lovely pub down the street. I expected better from Sonoma.

Services was exemplary. Food was average at best despite having unique dishes on the menu. Wine selection left something to be desired but it meet the standard for wine bars in DC. I’m not sure if this location has any relation to the Sonoma restaurants in Southern California but if so, they missed the mark in DC.

We showed up at 6:30 on Saturday with no reservation. We got 2 seats at the bar and we're delighted with the quality of the food, wine and service. Be warned that they get slammed with pre and post show crowds for nearby Folger (and other?) Theater
Really enjoyed the food and wine, unfortunately the beer taps were not working when I stopped in.
A cozy spot with good food right on Capitol hill.
Excellent charcuterie and good wine. I enjoyed the meal there.
Good food
Very creative menu and food was outstanding .  Service great.  A real dining out experience.

I went here last Friday night after being a first time visitor to DC. They do not like young people. Truthfully, it was the worst restaurant experience ever. The host first pretended to not see our reservation, but at that point, I didn’t think anything of it. We then showed her a screenshot of our reservation and she said “omg sorry I didn’t see it”. We saw it was happy hour, and we asked our waiter about the specials. He told us happy hour was at the upstairs bar and that we could go up whenever we wanted, so we went up to get drinks and came back down to our table. Keep in mind that many servers saw us bring our drinks downstairs. This next sentence entails the worst moment. The second time we tried going upstairs, our waiter stopped us dead in our tracks and said you are not allowed to bring drinks from upstairs down here. We were scolded in front of everyone. Embarrassing to say the least.
Unlike weekdays when it can be noisy,  Sat is quiet and conversation is easy. Service friendly and. accommodating. Food top rate.
(Translated by Google) Great service  (Original) Super service
Only California cuisine in the district! Great wine.
Classic Choice

We popped in to Sonoma for lunch and were pleasantly surprised. The service was excellent and atmosphere enjoyable. The food was outstanding! I had a chicken club with a side salad and it was delicious. I'm usually apprehensive about ordering a brioche bun because they are so heavy and filling but this one was perfect. Also reasonably priced especially for DC. My husband had the Seven Hills burger and it was delicious. I hope to be back before I leave the area.
I attended a catered event, the food was locally sourced and delicious.  The wine was enjoyable and the atmosphere helped me enjoy a normally excruciating work dinner.
Great service and selection.
Lovely place and staff. I would recommend booking as we came in at 6 and it was packed. Eating at the bar was still lovely but if you want a table booking is the best option.
Good food and good vibes. Very nice restaurant. Food was great.
Very good and they speak English and Spanish
Wine. Apps. Food. Service. The best.
Upscale atmosphere with a West coast vibe. Service was excellent and prompt for a large lunch group. Food was tasty, simple (sandwiches, pizzas and salads) and well prepared.
The food and the service was excellent
good food
Great staff, atmosphere and food
Nice place, not expensive.
Typical DC watering hole. Good ambiance and service.

Stopped in for a glass of wine and some lunch after checking out the surrounding sites.  The wine was fine, but the pizza was honestly not good.  I ordered the Margherita and the dough was chewy / didn’t seem cooked through.  It was pretty flavorless as well and kind of reminded me of frozen pizza reheated :/ def not worth the price.
Worst name ever. Get away

Overpriced! The lamb burger with parm fries was $22, pretty good but a bit dry. Spaghetti with clams was delicious, but $25 for a small serving with only 4 small over cooked clams! The fountain poured ginger ale was $4.50!?! Why!!! Wine and service were good.
Great selection of wines
Excellent service, and great food!
Superb wine selection.  Very nice veal burgers for a medium weight dinner
Great place to relax
Amazing pizza and desert. Highly recommend. Great atmosphere for date night.
Superior service and excellent food.
Food is okay, but the service was terrible. I was there on a weekday for lunch.

Had my rehearsal dinner here. The location was the closest to the church, so it was really the only option for a nice dinner within walking distance. The food was good and the service was excellent, but the communication with the event coordinator, Hilary, was very difficult, which made it kind of a sour experience. We had about 50-60 people from out of town who were all planning to meet us Friday night after the dinner, and they have the perfect lounge area for everyone to mingle and have drinks. We opted not to formally reserve the area so that people could open individual tabs since you have to pay the tab on one bill to reserve the area. Hilary assured us that we could grab any available space after dinner at 8:30 PM. Her exact words in writing were "If you want guests to pay for their drinks individually, then I won't reserve the space in advance, and your group can just come over to the bar after your dinner and grab whatever couches or high tops in the room happen to be available." However, when everyone starting arriving, they immediately close down the lounge and tell us we have to go to the downstairs bar. It was very embarrassing since all my out of town guests were standing around in a dark lounge. It was only 8:30PM, and we had 50 people ready to spend money in the lounge on overpriced drinks. So, we moved downstairs and had to stand at a crowded bar around other people having dinner. We gave them so much business that night, and all we really got was. "Sorry for the miscommunication." It was very disappointing on a very special night. I just wish she had told us there was a chance of it closing, so we could have planned an after party at a better location with better service (like Hawk N Dove).
The service was good as well as the food. I am definitely going back.
Only had drinks. Wine pour is heavy. Staff super friendly.
Delicious food and wonderful servers

(Translated by Google) Marie Claude September 21, 2018 Modern restaurant, very nice and very well located, not far from the capitol. The waiters are very friendly, attentive. Very good food. The card is not very big but the products are of very good quality. Quality wines and beers. Recommended address.  (Original) Marie Claude Le 21 septembre 2018 Restaurant au cadre moderne, très agréable et très bien situé, pas très loin du capitole. Les serveurs sont très sympathiques, à l’écoute. Très bonne cuisine. La carte n’est pas très grande mais les produits sont de très bonne qualité. Vins et bières de qualité. Adresse recommandée.
Great food and perfect location close to Capitol Hill. Prices were decent for the quality. Had the ribeye and it was perfect. Ambiance is modern but casual.
Er States in Washington in 5 data - Eat her in Thee.
Awesome food excellent service!

Sonoma is THEE place to go for a great meal on Capitol Hill. Pastas are exquisite as is their cocktail, wine, and beer programme. Great staff, too! Went most recently to their annual crab feast. A must do event during the summer!
Went for restaurant week the food was pretty meh. Have been many times over the years and it seems like the whole place has become kind of tired.

Phenomenal experience! If you're lucky enough to have Nick as your waiter (the guy is a consummate master), ask him for recommendations, he just nails it every time. Really incredible restaurant with a wine selection and atmosphere that is tough to beat.
I'm a big fan of the meatballs and polenta.

Went in for a bottle of wine...sat at bar. Friendly service and good wine selection. Complementary beignets were awesome! Food coming out of the kitchen looked great. We definitely need to go back for dinner soon!
Great food, great service.
Food was excellent but expensive. Wine was very good and reasonably priced. Good service. Expect to pay well over $50 per person.

I ordered online through GrubHub. A burger medium with fries. No salad. It arrived with no fries and with salad. The restaurant tried to explain that it wasn’t salad but the burger toppings. The lettuce was shredded and there was bite size pieces of carrots and cucumbers. And salad dressing. It was most definitely salad! And the medium burger arrived dry and charred. I sent it back. When my order arrived the second time, it was still so wrong. There was no salad and burger toppings actually looked like burger toppings. A vast difference from the first time. But I specifically requested that even though I didn’t want a bun that I still wanted the special aioli. There was none! The burger was kind of medium, but still charred on the outside. There were fries, but about half of them weren’t cooked. Seriously, they crunched! Disgusting. I called them back. They gave me the name and email of the manager. I emailed her and absolutely no reaponse. I may have forgiven this fiasco as a one time event if I’d actually received an email. But nothing. Do not recommend ever.

(Translated by Google) Nice restaurant with very nice waiters. The food is very good. Do not hesitate to have a good meal there.  (Original) Joli restaurant avec des serveurs très sympa. La nourriture est très bonne. N'hésitez pas à y prendre un bon repas.
Great breakfast menu and great service.
Cool place to hang after work
Always fabulous food, wine and service.

OK the wine was good. The spaghetti vongole though - spaghetti boiled to death and then brought reluctantly back to zombiedom by a pile of chilli. Seven clams. Six were chewy, one hadn’t opened in cooking but was still served. Fortunately no-one asked if I’d enjoyed my meal.
Food was delicious and creative.  Prices were very reasonable and service was wonderful.
nice for a work lunch! Burger is amazing.
We enjoyed lunch...mushroom burgers, mac-n-ch lobster, & pizzas...all great! You get what you pay for, DC good isn't cheap, but most places here are priced like this...this was worth it!
Good food here for a business lunch. The only real drawback is that it's noisy, so if you're with a group it can be hard to hear the conversation.

We had a reservations at 7:45 and were running late.  I called in and they moved it to 8:15 with no problems. Chris was an amazing waiter and gave great wine recommendations. Freak Show is the best! We are in town for the weekend for Philadelphia and we were able to get some good suggestions for other places to try. The only downside is the Margarita Pizza was the only meh aspect. It could’ve used more basil and garlic. Otherwise we had a great time and would recommend this to friends and family.
Best place to go on the whole strip.
The food was amazing!
Great food great wine!
Excellent pizza - other had cauliflower and salmon but the cauliflower was raw and barely braised -- waaay too expensive
Great wine selection at Happy Hour, good nibble food & great atmosphere!
Good food, though rather pricey. The atmosphere is quite nice and it's not too noisy for conversation. Service was excellent.

Had a lovely dinner with the server Lindsey last night.  She recommended a lovely white for my friend and I and helped us navigate through the charcuterie and cheese. We went ahead with a charcuterie board of manchego & 1 other cheese and the duck prosciutto & prosciutto do Parma. The board was delicious however the bread that comes with the board is lacking something... either their focaccia needs to be grilled longer or brushed with garlic/EVOO to give it flavor. The charcuterie was delicious and was served with a nice amount of prosciutto di Parma and thinly sliced pieces of the duck prosciutto which melted in you mouth.  For main my friend got the spaghetti vongole & I had the mint papardelle with lamb Ragu. The mint papardelle were definitely interesting and had an enjoyable taste. My friends vongole had just the amount of clam broth at the bottom helping the pasta to not dry out & remaining flavorful.  If you’re visiting for dinner and are sensitive to cold I’d suggest to get seated farther inside as the restaurant did get a little cold but that’s just expected of winter time!

Good restaurant, with a wide ranging menu and the food was decent. However we booked a table for 8:30 and the restaurant closes at 9 so all felt very strange and rushed. We were told it is a problem with the booking system.
Fancy business lunch atmosphere

Great restaurant! I went with a friend for restaurant week. We got the arugula salad, the seafood chowder, the salmon dish and the steak dish, and lemon ricotta beignets. Everything was great, especially paired with the wine that was on special that evening. I'd recommend going.

Very nice staff and great wine menu.   Also, the decor was fabulous.  A great place to go for a nice night for some drinking.  The food however, was extremely bland and a bit over cooked or too mushy.   I don't think they know that salt exists.

Sonoma is a cool restraint with outstanding atmosphere, great food and find drinks. The service has always been impeccable. I've enjoyed happy hours and special events at Sonoma - it's a quality DC establishment
Solid wine bar
Great food and wine. Nice, clean and modern restaurant.
Perfectly located near the House Office Buildings, this is a welcome refuge from the politicos nearby.  Wonderful lunch selections and efficient staff.
Had a fun brunch here with make your own mimosas
Still a great spot for lunch.
Really nice wait staff.  Interesting dishes.

The whole experience was fantastic.We met Mario on the metro. He was so casual when he recommended his restaurant. Everything was great we had the trout.the risotto,ribeye and the gnocchi. The salads were also great. The service was also fantastic. Go Go Go........

Hilton Resort was high quality and comfortable. Very nice decor and friendly staff. My husband and I enjoyed our stay and plan on coming back. We loved the view of the lake and the grounds. The local resturants were also nice!
I can't speak to dinner but the lunch was rather good.  The "Sonoma" BLT was nothing more than a rudimentary BLT the the Brussels sprouts side was amazing.
Very nice place for lunch!
Bartender didnt want me at the establishment -this is from early summertime last year. Never went back

Decent service but the food wasn't anything special. Squash risotto was over cooked and brussel sprouts came out soggy. They were happy they let us camp out and talk for awhile after our meal. There was no attempt to push us out the door.
The octopus is delicious and the pizza was very impressive too. I was told the burger was so far the best they tried in DC. Check it out
Really good food and wine. Our initial sever "went missing" a couple of times but another one stepped in to assist - wish we'd had her from the start.
One of the best burgers in DC.  The pizza is also pretty good.  If you like octopus, the appetizer here is a must.  Great wine and chill vibe
The food quality has gone way down hill. Service is still good and friendly. But there are much better options all within walking distance.
Great place and people
While I only stopped for drinks, I have to say the staff is just great. They truly make you feel welcome and offer great service. I will be back.

This place was great. The atmosphere is nice the wine bar is extensive and the food is awesome. They have a wide array of choices from specialty personal pizzas, to a burgers, to trout, to pasta. It is a little pricy and you do need to call in a reservation unless you want to eat at the bar.
The gnocchi were delicious.
Average food with long waiting time.

Host:  Welcoming, let us sit at the table we requested (I made sure to ask if it would throw off server sections and she said not at all) 5/5  Setting:  Dimly lit and warm, not too noisy.  Liked the ambiance 4/5  Server:  Terrible. It was my expectation at a wine bar that the service staff should know about wine and be willing, maybe even feel directed (!) toward helping explain the wine program and the various offerings.  I ordered a pre-designed flight as my server was mostly missing.  The server lined the flights up on the table and proceeded to walk away without telling us which wine was which.  I had to call him back and ask him, only for him to go back to the bar to find out.  The server also brought my partner's salad before the wine (another, maybe unreasonable, expectation of mine).  After we finished, the table was bussed and the server basically threw the dessert menu on our table without saying anything.  Only because we received what we ordered: 1/5.  I've been given more thoughtful service by my Doordash delivery person.  Food:  Good. Nothing special.  Octopus, broccoli, wedge salad and burger were good. 3/5  Wine:  Good.  Nothing special.  I only found out after we ordered that servers could help us create flights.  I found the flight to be mediocre.  3/5  Overall:  A restaurant that bills itself as a wine bar should have a staff that is knowledgeable and engaging.  That was not apparent here, in fact, it was the opposite.  I even felt like I shouldn't be sitting at the table.  That's not my expectation of good service.  If you want to go to a wine bar, go to Cork.  Both of my experiences there were outstanding.

For months, I have heard more and more buzz around this wine bar on Capitol Hill. My wife and I decided to check it out on one of our weekly date nights. We had dinner at home and just wanted a drink. Sonoma was perfect for that. The first floor has their main bar and places to eat. The upstairs is set up like a lounge with plenty of couches and chairs to sit at.  I cannot speak for their food, but they had great wine selections. We asked our server what he recommended and we both took him up on his suggestions. It was a home run! We loved our wine choices (I had their gewurztraminer).  Definitely go with a group and enjoy their lounge if you want a chill, yet classy evening on Capitol Hill.
Amazing food. Endless mimosa is truly endless. Chris kept our drinks full and the brunch fun.  I highly recommend for good quality as well.
Waiter was rude even though restaurant was not busy. Took an hour for them to figure out the checks.

(Translated by Google) Very good restaurant. Card small but balanced dishes and reasonable size. The grilled salmon was perfect, like the vanilla cheese cake  (Original) Très bon restaurant. Carte petite mais plats équilibrés et de taille raisonnable. Le saumon grillé était parfait, comme le cheese cake  vanille
Fresh salad paired with ice cold Arnold Palmer and unique soups make Sonoma stand out. Wine director is terrific - new vinos come in on Thursdays!
Very nice!!!

In a long block of pretty average places, this stands out as a unique favorite with comfy couches, great 2nd floor view of the street and traffic below, and a wide complement of whites and reds.  The $5 happy hour selections are superb.  The food is minimal, so this is a place to go before or after dinner, but the cheese and charcuterie boards are good enough to keep you tided over until the next glass.

I usually stop by here for the Italian Happy Hour. You can have wine for $5 a glass and 3 small plates for $9. I've had the meatballs which were tender and delicious, burrata, and the charred octopus. Also have shared a great charcuterie tray with friends nice variety.
Amazing service.  From the management down, I received personal attention well beyond my expectations.

I have lunched here many times and always found the food tasty. Most recently, I went there for happy hour. The second floor lounge, which is chic and enjoyable, features $5 glasses of red and white wine. I ordered a three-item sampler plate (olives, fried calamari, bruschetta) for $9 and was delighted at the sizable platter of eats I received. I'll be back soon! (Visited 4/15/14)
Wonderful
Fantastic! beautiful restaurant, we particularly like the upstairs lounge, perfect for meeting friends. The declaration is one of my favorites. I know a nice decor when I see one.  Recommended.

I LOVE this place! Food, wine, and service is great! The upstairs lounge is really cool, too. The pork dish I ordered was perfectly cooked, and so delicious! I will definitely be returning to Sonoma Restaurant + Wine Bar!

Sonoma is a great wine bar tucked away on Pennsylvania and walking distance from the Capitol. Their menu may be small but the cheese platters are full of flavor and the flatbreads filling that getting 3-4 items to share with the table is a great weeknight dinner...and goes well with any of their wine.
Go for wine and a cheese plate. You'll be happy.

I absolutely love this place!! I love that they have normal portion sizes (I believe they refer to them as appetizer sized), which helps to make it more affordable and somewhere I like to go to more since you don't end up with a ton of food you can't eat. I'm a big fan of the amish chicken with pasta. And their wine selection -- fabulous. Reservations defintiely are recommended. I haven't been disappointed here though yet. Perfect ambiance.
